*Project Updates:*

_AFAB Project_
• Sprint 2 delivered on Oct 1, including demo to client. 
• UAT started; one issue identified and currently in progress by Dev team.
• Sprint 3 kicked off, focused on the technical setup for the Multi-Organization implementation. Target delivery estimated for Oct 30. May need one extra sprint.
• Two security issues reported by client — under investigation to include in backlog and address later if timing allows.
• Overall project status: On track and progressing according to plan
_CARPEDM_
• UX design for iOS still In Progress → this SOW is delayed, due to delayed client feedback.
• regarding this iOS is SOW: Issued partial invoice for approved flows (Home/Dashboard & Profile).
• Provided production support (user updates, SMS bug fix, ChargeBee- Database reported issue).
• Backlog for October refined, awaiting client confirmation to proceed.
_Chromatics GEO_
• Started with Sprint 1 last week
• Backend is in progress, query generator already being evaluated
• Frontend is under refinenemt. Team is working closely with client to confirm expected behavior
• Overall Project Status: On track

_Chromatics GEO_
• Started with Sprint 1 last week
• Backend is in progress, query generator already being evaluated
• Frontend is under refinenemt. Team is working closely with client to confirm expected behavior
• Overall Project Status: On track

elements.text: Sprint 2 delivered on Oct 1, including demo to client.
UAT started; one issue identified and currently in progress by Dev team.
Sprint 3 kicked off, focused on the technical setup for the Multi-Organization implementation. Target delivery estimated for Oct 30. May need one extra sprint.
Two security issues reported by client — under investigation to include in backlog and address later if timing allows.
Overall project status: On track and progressing according to plan
UX design for iOS still In Progress → this SOW is delayed, due to delayed client feedback.
regarding this iOS is SOW: Issued partial invoice for approved flows (Home/Dashboard & Profile).
Provided production support (user updates, SMS bug fix, ChargeBee- Database reported issue).
Backlog for October refined, awaiting client confirmation to proceed.
Backend is in progress, query generator already being evaluated
Frontend is under refinenemt. Team is working closely with client to confirm expected behavior

¿Ya tuvo la entrevista Cesar con CHR?
¿Podrán compartir feedback por favor?
¡Gracias!
Nora

On Fri, Oct 3, 2025 at 10:53 AM Melisa Behotas <mbehotas@celaralabs.com>
wrote:

> Nora, te comparto el feedback de Emiliano acerca de la entrevista técnica:
>
> "- Tiene más experiencia con proyectos de datos tabulares, además de
> cierta exposición a problemas de NLP tradicionales. Trabajó en una
> aplicación de recomendación con arquitectura RAG.
> - No posee experiencia con problemas de computer vision (no requerido por
> Chromatics)
> - No tiene experiencia realizando finetuning de modelos.
> - Ante la definición de la arquitectura de una solución para
> segmentación/NLP, hizo foco en el análisis de los datos y no tanto en la
> resolución del problema. En particular, para la extracción de datos
> estructurados propuso el uso de un modelo de extracción preentrenado en vez
> de hacer foco en LLMs.
> - Su conocimiento teórico de transformers es muy limitado.
> - Completó el live coding de forma satisfactoria.
> - Si bien se precipita para desarrollar, ese es su fuerte: Tiene foco en
> resolver.
> - No utilizó en ningún momento ChatGPT/similar (ni en pantalla, ni como
> asistencia automática de autocompletado, ni de alguna forma que resulte
> evidente).
> - Requiere de la guía de alguien con mayor seniority, o alguien que le
> organice las prioridades. También estimo que su nerviosismo pudo haber
> influido en su organización.
> - Sus técnicas para mejorar prompts son adecuadas pero requieren aún de
> mayor experiencia y aprendizaje.
> - Posee un gran grado de independencia, ante la posibilidad de consultarme
> intentó no hacerlo.
>
> Creo que es un perfil SSr/SSr+ que podría cumplir con lo justo con lo
> requerido por Chromatics AI. Sus prácticas no son sólidas, pero su afán de
> resolver lo hace interesante. De estar acompañado con un Sr podría
> representar un camino de crecimiento para él."
>

messages.subject: Re: HR - Feedback for Cesar Seminario - CHR
messages.text:
Oh sorry I missed this - Ive had bad internet and quite slow..

I will be completely offline tomorrow - catching on Friday a bit….and hopefully a bit better connected next week.

But please for anything that needs a response within 2 days - use WhatsApp.

Thx


Zubair Talib 
Executive Director
zubair@celaralabs.com <mailto:zubair@celaralabs.com>
+17033620253 <tel:+17033622053>

> On Oct 3, 2025, at 7:14 PM, Carolina Tommasi <ctommasi@celaralabs.com> wrote:
> 
> Zubair, I’m sharing the information about this candidate, the second one who performed well during the live coding.
> He is not a Senior profile, but he has strengths that make him a potential fit for Chromatics.
> 
> Emi's comments:
> "His experience is primarily focused on tabular data projects, with some exposure to traditional NLP problems. He worked on a recommendation application using a RAG architecture.
> He has not performed model fine tuning so far.
> When defining the architecture for a segmentation/NLP solution, his focus was more on data analysis than on the problem-solving approach. For structured data extraction, for example, he suggested using a pretrained extraction model instead of relying on LLMs.
> His theoretical knowledge of transformers is basic.
> He completed the live coding exercise successfully.
> His main strength lies in maintaining a strong focus on problem-solving.
> He did not use ChatGPT or similar tools at any point (not on screen, nor as autocomplete assistance ).
> He would benefit from guidance from someone more senior, especially in prioritization. His nervousness during the process may also have influenced his organization.
> His prompt improvement techniques are on the right track, though they could be strengthened further with more experience.
> He demonstrates a high level of independence; even when given the chance to ask questions, he preferred to work through the challenges on his own.
> 
> Overall, I see him as a solid SSr++ profile who could meet Chromatics AI’s requirements. While some practices still need consolidation, his problem-solving drive and independence make him a promising candidate."
> 
> 
> 
> <CV Celara_Cesar Seminario Calle.pdf><Screening Celara_ Cesar Seminario Calle.pdf>

messages.text:
Buen día Nora!
Enviamos el CV de Cesar al cliente y nos contestó esto:
"Thank you for the CV.    For the first employee, we need someone who will
be very senior and can lead a team.

Maybe Cesar can be taken into consideration as employee number 2."

El mié, 8 oct 2025 a las 15:08, Nora Urso (<noraurso@gmail.com>) escribió:

> Gracias Caro.
>
> On Wed, Oct 8, 2025 at 10:26 AM Carolina Tommasi <ctommasi@celaralabs.com>
> wrote:
>
>> Nora, buen día !
>>

>> complica coordinar.
>> Te tengo al tanto.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> On Tue, Oct 7, 2025 at 5:00 PM Nora Urso <noraurso@gmail.com> wrote:
>>
>>> Hola Caro y Meli.
>>> ¿Ya tuvo la entrevista Cesar con CHR?
>>> ¿Podrán compartir feedback por favor?
>>> ¡Gracias!
>>> Nora
>>>
>>> On Fri, Oct 3, 2025 at 10:53 AM Melisa Behotas <mbehotas@celaralabs.com>
>>> wrote:
>>>
>>>> Nora, te comparto el feedback de Emiliano acerca de la entrevista
>>>> técnica:
>>>>
>>>> "- Tiene más experiencia con proyectos de datos tabulares, además de
>>>> cierta exposición a problemas de NLP tradicionales. Trabajó en una
>>>> aplicación de recomendación con arquitectura RAG.
>>>> - No posee experiencia con problemas de computer vision (no requerido
>>>> por Chromatics)
>>>> - No tiene experiencia realizando finetuning de modelos.
>>>> - Ante la definición de la arquitectura de una solución para
>>>> segmentación/NLP, hizo foco en el análisis de los datos y no tanto en la
>>>> resolución del problema. En particular, para la extracción de datos
>>>> estructurados propuso el uso de un modelo de extracción preentrenado en vez
>>>> de hacer foco en LLMs.
>>>> - Su conocimiento teórico de transformers es muy limitado.
>>>> - Completó el live coding de forma satisfactoria.
>>>> - Si bien se precipita para desarrollar, ese es su fuerte: Tiene foco
>>>> en resolver.
>>>> - No utilizó en ningún momento ChatGPT/similar (ni en pantalla, ni como
>>>> asistencia automática de autocompletado, ni de alguna forma que resulte
>>>> evidente).
>>>> - Requiere de la guía de alguien con mayor seniority, o alguien que le
>>>> organice las prioridades. También estimo que su nerviosismo pudo haber
>>>> influido en su organización.
>>>> - Sus técnicas para mejorar prompts son adecuadas pero requieren aún de
>>>> mayor experiencia y aprendizaje.
>>>> - Posee un gran grado de independencia, ante la posibilidad de
>>>> consultarme intentó no hacerlo.
>>>>
>>>> Creo que es un perfil SSr/SSr+ que podría cumplir con lo justo con lo
>>>> requerido por Chromatics AI. Sus prácticas no son sólidas, pero su afán de
>>>> resolver lo hace interesante. De estar acompañado con un Sr podría
>>>> representar un camino de crecimiento para él."
>>>>

>>>>

setup). Sprint

EN PROPUESTA

      Propuesta. @German Grin <ggrin@celaralabs.com> Esperando rta.

Compartimos tu perfil con el *cliente* <https://www.chromatics.ai/> para la
vacante de *AI Engineer*
<https://jobs.lever.co/celaralabs/23096584-0b9e-4006-b443-42f9f0e0600f>

messages.subject: Re: HR - AI searching status 2025-10-15
messages.text:
thank you and good work. 

I don’t think guido or german will work

we do need agility and strong confident ability to learn

they don’t need lots of ai experience but you would likely be pleased in their core fundamentals and abilities to learn. 

Sent from my iPhone

> On Oct 15, 2025, at 11:22 PM, Carolina Tommasi <ctommasi@celaralabs.com> wrote:
> 
> ﻿
> Hi Zubair,
> 
> We are sharing with you the current status of the AI search:
> 
> Internal
> - Javier Curutchet: HR and tech interviews.  Scheduling interview with you for next week.
> German summary (detailed feedback attached):
> Positive. The candidate demonstrated a very good attitude and a willingness to work outside the strict scope of the role and solve whatever is necessary. However, it is noted that the candidate is junior in the AI field, lacking specific experience in managing LLMs (Large Language Models), and would therefore require mentorship/guidance.
> 
> - Guido Ducasse:  HR and tech interviews. Please let us know if you agree to move forward with him.
> Emiliano summary  (detailed feedback attached):
> I believe he has a Ssr- (Senior-Minus) level, with very little specific AI knowledge. His capacity for adapting to adverse situations seems limited. I am not sure he meets the expectations for the role. He might only be useful if a high level of agility isn't expected in the projects he handles, and if it's accepted that he will still require training and experience
> 
> - German Pannunzio: HR interview. Very Jr profile. Please let us know if you agree to move forward to the tech interview.
> HR summary 
> Very good attitude, he is willing to learn and expand his experience. Currently in the final year of his studies at UBA, he works for a large company (Mercap), where some of his tasks are not aligned with his interests. He is open to working on-site, he needs mentoring, particularly in AI-related tasks.
> 
> - Rodrigo Pardo Diaz: We sent him a message yesterday to coordinate a call, but he hasn’t responded yet.
> 
> - Sebastian García Nallar: Tech interview went well. When attempting to schedule with the client, there were delays, then Sebastian did not respond.
>

messages.subject: Re: Tech Interview: Franco Anton Gallo - AI Engineer
messages.text:
Meli, como estás?

Te paso el feedback completo:

Franco Anton Gallo

Work Experience:

   - Many years mostly as Developer, in multiple relevant roles
   - Last experience focused on Python
      - integraciones, librerías comunes
      - langchain, llamaindex, chroma
      - groq, ollama, openai, anthropic
      - AWS / Azure
   - Latest projects
      - Tools for finding, engaging and tracking marketing leads
      - AI Hub, able to connect and integrate any AI to other tools based
      on official docs
      - Voice Channels: use of Elevenlabs for TTS, live calls with real
      time processing, setup of regular parameters like emotions but also added
      proprietary features for naturalness, like background noise,
voice cues and
      nudging, and hypothesis creation and processing to minimize unexpected
      silences
   - Experience with finetuning: several models used to prevent emails
   captured by spam filters, to generate natural emails and response, and use
   of open models for fallback in case cloud ones have issues

Live Coding:

   - During live coding showed a very structured approach, defining
   threading, data structures, pydantic models, and api endpoints before
   coding the algorithms
   - When creating pydantic models, used Field, Descriptions and
   Validators, even when not required
   - For sentiment analysis, created a transformers pipeline instead of
   just executing the prompt
   - For LLM response, defined a Regex to extract the specific value that
   was required. When asked about it, mentioned that the expected model (Qwen
   0.6B) is unreliable and likely to generate a response with extra wording,
   so it would help to standardize the result.


Theoretical Questions:

   - when asked about entity extraction from documents explained a complete
   pipeline for the problem based on previous experience for CV processing in
   a recruiting setup
   - When asked about Image Processing, suggested using OpenCV to generate
   a dataset and manually validate. With that, train or fine tune a model for
   the specific case with at least 1000 images
   - Asked about transformers, response is less academic and more based on
   usage and general knowledge, but still a good answer



Overall, the evaluation is very positive. The candidate shows proficiency
in engineering techniques and also good understanding on AI-based
applications and architecture.

*AFAB Project* 
• *Finishing Sprint 3 – demo to client performed on Thu 16th:*
•  Sprint 3 was a *technical sprint* focused on preparing the platform to support multiple clients.
•  It involved *important changes* impacting the current data model, database structure, and security layer of the platform.
•  Due to the scope and importance of these changes, the sprint took longer than expected.
• *Overall project status:* Still *on track* to deliver the project by the *first week of Nov*.
*CARPEDM* 
• *UX design for iOS* still in progress → this SOW is *delayed* due to pending client feedback.
• *“Migration iOS to Web”* *approved* — development to start this week with Lorenzo
• *Provided production support*, including calendar issues, Webflow updated, database updates.
• *Sprint for October* prioritized and started to fully utilize the monthly hours.
*Chromatics GEO* 
• Executing sprint 2
• Backend is advanced, with API endpoints, authorization and AI pipelines in progress
• Frontend is a bit delayed, but expectable considering the dependency related to backend
• Overall project status: on track

messages.subject: Re: Weekly hoy
messages.text:
Buen día Nora, te comparto las novedades por acá:
Las búsquedas de QB están on hold, no están recibiendo nuevos candidatos
(.Net, QA, QA Lead, SE)
Seguimos con las búsquedas de AI para Chromatics, aunque tenemos candidatos
en proceso. En cuanto nos den el OK para avanzar con la búsqueda de AI SR
(NO PO) te aviso, así chequeamos disponibilidad de César.

Gracias!

El vie, 24 oct 2025 a las 10:02, Nora Urso (<noraurso@gmail.com>) escribió:

> Buen día Caro y Melisa, mirando la página de Celara no veo que haya
> búsquedas nuevas. De ser así, paso la call de hoy y hablamos el viernes
> próximo.
> Buen finde para ambas,
> Nora
>


-- 

[image: photo]

Melisa Behotas
Talent Team

[image: Email Icon]mbehotas@celaralabs.com <REPLACE_EMAIL>

Franco really enjoyed the interview and believes it's a good company. He'd like to advance and is asking about the next steps. I'm putting Franco in touch with Chromatics so they can continue the process.

messages.subject: HR - Franco <> Chromatics Offer
messages.text:
Hi Franco,

Just to say congratulations - we really liked you - happy to make you an
offer to work with Chromatics and Celara.  The official offer letter will
come from Chromatics - the salary we’ve discussed - they will just finalize
the paperwork and payments details with you.

Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions in the meantime,
we’re excited to have you on board!

Best!

-- 

[image: photo]

Melisa Behotas
Talent Team

[image: Email Icon]mbehotas@celaralabs.com <REPLACE_EMAIL>

Franco

messages.subject: Re: AI Engineer SR | PO - Franco Antón Gallo
messages.text:
Amyn, I'm adding information to Franco's offer.
He currently has 15 PTOs (vacation days) plus 5 sick days, and he would
like to keep them.

Let me know if that is ok with you.


El vie, 17 oct 2025 a las 13:43, Melisa Behotas (<mbehotas@celaralabs.com>)
escribió:

> Hi Amyn!
>
> We're sharing *Franco Antón Gallo´s* profile for the *AI Engineer* *SR |
> PO *role.
> He is a *very strong candidate* who fits the needs of Chromatics well.
> He is currently involved in *another selection process*, so I suggest we
> move quickly to the next step.
>
> The feedback from our tech Interview is:
> Work Experience:
>
>    - Many years mostly as Developer, in multiple relevant roles
>    - Last experience focused on Python
>       - integraciones, librerías comunes
>       - langchain, llamaindex, chroma
>       - groq, ollama, openai, anthropic
>       - AWS / Azure
>    - Latest projects
>       - Tools for finding, engaging and tracking marketing leads
>       - AI Hub, able to connect and integrate any AI to other tools based
>       on official docs
>       - Voice Channels: use of Elevenlabs for TTS, live calls with real
>       time processing, setup of regular parameters like emotions but also added
>       proprietary features for naturalness, like background noise, voice cues and
>       nudging, and hypothesis creation and processing to minimize unexpected
>       silences
>    - Experience with finetuning: several models used to prevent emails
>    captured by spam filters, to generate natural emails and response, and use
>    of open models for fallback in case cloud ones have issues
>
> Live Coding:
>
>    - During live coding showed a very structured approach, defining
>    threading, data structures, pydantic models, and api endpoints before
>    coding the algorithms
>    - When creating pydantic models, used Field, Descriptions and
>    Validators, even when not required
>    - For sentiment analysis, created a transformers pipeline instead of
>    just executing the prompt
>    - For LLM response, defined a Regex to extract the specific value that
>    was required. When asked about it, mentioned that the expected model (Qwen
>    0.6B) is unreliable and likely to generate a response with extra wording,
>    so it would help to standardize the result.
>
>
> Theoretical Questions:
>
>    - when asked about entity extraction from documents explained a
>    complete pipeline for the problem based on previous experience for CV
>    processing in a recruiting setup
>    - When asked about Image Processing, suggested using OpenCV to
>    generate a dataset and manually validate. With that, train or fine tune a
>    model for the specific case with at least 1000 images
>    - Asked about transformers, response is less academic and more based
>    on usage and general knowledge, but still a good answer
>
> Overall, the evaluation is very positive. The candidate shows proficiency
> in engineering techniques and also good understanding on AI-based
> applications and architecture.
>
> *Salary expectation:* USD 9000.-
>
> *Please let me know if you need anything further. *
> Best!
>
> --
>
> [image: photo]
>
> Melisa Behotas
> Talent Team
>
> [image: Email Icon]mbehotas@celaralabs.com <REPLACE_EMAIL>
>
>

-- 

[image: photo]

Melisa Behotas
Talent Team

[image: Email Icon]mbehotas@celaralabs.com <REPLACE_EMAIL>

Hello Melisa,

I thought the offer letter was coming from Chromatics?   If you are sending it, can I review it first.

For the vacation and person days, is he asking a normal amount?

>> Hi Amyn! 
>> 
>> We're sharing Franco Antón Gallo´s profile for the AI Engineer SR | PO role.
>> He is a very strong candidate who fits the needs of Chromatics well. 
>> He is currently involved in another selection process, so I suggest we move quickly to the next step. 
>> 
>> The feedback from our tech Interview is: 
>> Work Experience: 
>> Many years mostly as Developer, in multiple relevant roles
>> Last experience focused on Python
>> integraciones, librerías comunes
>> langchain, llamaindex, chroma
>> groq, ollama, openai, anthropic
>> AWS / Azure
>> Latest projects
>> Tools for finding, engaging and tracking marketing leads
>> AI Hub, able to connect and integrate any AI to other tools based on official docs
>> Voice Channels: use of Elevenlabs for TTS, live calls with real time processing, setup of regular parameters like emotions but also added proprietary features for naturalness, like background noise, voice cues and nudging, and hypothesis creation and processing to minimize unexpected silences
>> Experience with finetuning: several models used to prevent emails captured by spam filters, to generate natural emails and response, and use of open models for fallback in case cloud ones have issues
>> Live Coding:
>> During live coding showed a very structured approach, defining threading, data structures, pydantic models, and api endpoints before coding the algorithms
>> When creating pydantic models, used Field, Descriptions and Validators, even when not required
>> For sentiment analysis, created a transformers pipeline instead of just executing the prompt
>> For LLM response, defined a Regex to extract the specific value that was required. When asked about it, mentioned that the expected model (Qwen 0.6B) is unreliable and likely to generate a response with extra wording, so it would help to standardize the result.
>> 
>> Theoretical Questions:
>> when asked about entity extraction from documents explained a complete pipeline for the problem based on previous experience for CV processing in a recruiting setup
>> When asked about Image Processing, suggested using OpenCV to generate a dataset and manually validate. With that, train or fine tune a model for the specific case with at least 1000 images
>> Asked about transformers, response is less academic and more based on usage and general knowledge, but still a good answer
>> Overall, the evaluation is very positive. The candidate shows proficiency in engineering techniques and also good understanding on AI-based applications and architecture.
>> 
>> Salary expectation: USD 9000.-
>> 
>> Please let me know if you need anything further.   
>> Best!
>> 
>> --
>> 
>> Melisa Behotas
>> Talent Team
>> mbehotas@celaralabs.com <mailto:REPLACE_EMAIL>
>> 
> 
>

> Talent Team
> mbehotas@celaralabs.com <mailto:REPLACE_EMAIL>
>

>>
>>    - when asked about entity extraction from documents explained a
>>    complete pipeline for the problem based on previous experience for CV
>>    processing in a recruiting setup
>>    - When asked about Image Processing, suggested using OpenCV to
>>    generate a dataset and manually validate. With that, train or fine tune a
>>    model for the specific case with at least 1000 images
>>    - Asked about transformers, response is less academic and more based
>>    on usage and general knowledge, but still a good answer
>>
>> Overall, the evaluation is very positive. The candidate shows proficiency
>> in engineering techniques and also good understanding on AI-based
>> applications and architecture.
>>

messages.text:
Thank you.

I’ll amend it to the offer letter I was working on.

> On Oct 27, 2025, at 10:32 AM, Carolina Tommasi <ctommasi@celaralabs.com> wrote:
> 
> Hi Amyn,
> 
> Yes, the offer letter is from you/ Chromatics. Melissa was just pointing this out for us to keep in mind
> He’s asking for a reasonable amount for a Senior position.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> On Mon, Oct 27, 2025 at 11:28 AM Amyn Gillani <amyn.gillani@gmail.com <mailto:amyn.gillani@gmail.com>> wrote:
>> Hello Melisa,
>> 
>> I thought the offer letter was coming from Chromatics?   If you are sending it, can I review it first.
>> 
>> For the vacation and person days, is he asking a normal amount?
>> 
>>> On Oct 27, 2025, at 9:29 AM, Melisa Behotas <mbehotas@celaralabs.com <mailto:mbehotas@celaralabs.com>> wrote:
>>> 
>>> Amyn, I'm adding information to Franco's offer. 
>>> He currently has 15 PTOs (vacation days) plus 5 sick days, and he would like to keep them.
>>> 
>>> Let me know if that is ok with you.
>>> 
>>> 
>>> El vie, 17 oct 2025 a las 13:43, Melisa Behotas (<mbehotas@celaralabs.com <mailto:mbehotas@celaralabs.com>>) escribió:
>>>> Hi Amyn! 
>>>> 
>>>> We're sharing Franco Antón Gallo´s profile for the AI Engineer SR | PO role.
>>>> He is a very strong candidate who fits the needs of Chromatics well. 
>>>> He is currently involved in another selection process, so I suggest we move quickly to the next step. 
>>>> 
>>>> The feedback from our tech Interview is: 
>>>> Work Experience: 
>>>> Many years mostly as Developer, in multiple relevant roles
>>>> Last experience focused on Python
>>>> integraciones, librerías comunes
>>>> langchain, llamaindex, chroma
>>>> groq, ollama, openai, anthropic
>>>> AWS / Azure
>>>> Latest projects
>>>> Tools for finding, engaging and tracking marketing leads
>>>> AI Hub, able to connect and integrate any AI to other tools based on official docs
>>>> Voice Channels: use of Elevenlabs for TTS, live calls with real time processing, setup of regular parameters like emotions but also added proprietary features for naturalness, like background noise, voice cues and nudging, and hypothesis creation and processing to minimize unexpected silences
>>>> Experience with finetuning: several models used to prevent emails captured by spam filters, to generate natural emails and response, and use of open models for fallback in case cloud ones have issues
>>>> Live Coding:
>>>> During live coding showed a very structured approach, defining threading, data structures, pydantic models, and api endpoints before coding the algorithms
>>>> When creating pydantic models, used Field, Descriptions and Validators, even when not required
>>>> For sentiment analysis, created a transformers pipeline instead of just executing the prompt
>>>> For LLM response, defined a Regex to extract the specific value that was required. When asked about it, mentioned that the expected model (Qwen 0.6B) is unreliable and likely to generate a response with extra wording, so it would help to standardize the result.
>>>> 
>>>> Theoretical Questions:
>>>> when asked about entity extraction from documents explained a complete pipeline for the problem based on previous experience for CV processing in a recruiting setup
>>>> When asked about Image Processing, suggested using OpenCV to generate a dataset and manually validate. With that, train or fine tune a model for the specific case with at least 1000 images
>>>> Asked about transformers, response is less academic and more based on usage and general knowledge, but still a good answer
>>>> Overall, the evaluation is very positive. The candidate shows proficiency in engineering techniques and also good understanding on AI-based applications and architecture.
>>>> 
>>>> Salary expectation: USD 9000.-
>>>> 
>>>> Please let me know if you need anything further.   
>>>> Best!
>>>> 
>>>> --
>>>> 
>>>> Melisa Behotas
>>>> Talent Team
>>>> mbehotas@celaralabs.com <mailto:REPLACE_EMAIL>
>>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> --
>>> 
>>> Melisa Behotas
>>> Talent Team
>>> mbehotas@celaralabs.com <mailto:REPLACE_EMAIL>
>>> 
>>

         - *Chromatics *- *1 búsqueda casi cerrada & 1 in progress.*
         - *QU *reabrió una búsqueda y 2 postulantes in progress.

      Sin updates.

      Sin update.* Suspendidas Weeklys con cliente, sin updates. *
      - Portillos  *|* In progress Modalidad de soporte. No se pudo armar
      pipeline automático, así que in progress. German. *S**in updates. *


EN PROPUESTA

   - Go (Finanzas para México) - En propuesta. se envio propuesta, no
      respondió mas - no va a avanzar parece.
      - *Bankar *- Paraguay.  Procesan pagos (similar a Prisma). Se
      propuso POC chica para info de errores con pagos. Está en manos de Seba
      cerrar.  @Emiliano Gasparovic <egasparovic@celaralabs.com>
      - *Nissei Retail Paraguay *- mejoras en motor de búsqueda. Se envió
      Propuesta. @German Grin <ggrin@celaralabs.com> Esperando rta.

   PROSPECTOS:
   - PKF Colombia (Finanzas Cripto) - Lo tiene Seba.
      - *PKF Paraguay - cementera.*  Se pasó presupuesto, quedamos a espera
      de proyectos futuros.
      - *CEAMSE*. * On Hold lo de sistema de sensores. Y se activó una
      implementación SAP - se tercerizó. In progress. *
         - *Documentación y Monitoreo *están On Hold por el cliente.
      - *Aeropuertos argentinos 2000. *Sin Updates
      - *Lumina americas- *Sin Updates
      - *DAS (Congreso)* - Se arranca en octubre. Sin updates. German
      contactar a Luciano.
      - *Puertos DockSud* - Se arranca 2026
      - *Trenes Argentinos -* reunión 19/08. Está firme, pero no hay fecha
      de comienzo. On hold hasta 2026.
      - *CATHAY SAE*. Camiones, remolques. Paraguay. Reunión 20/10 con IT,
      fue contrario a la conversación de dueño. En manos de Seba.


Otras Actividades Internas - todo con prioridad baja

   - *AWS *Alinear con la parte comercial (Sebas Gonza) Pendiente. Sin
   Updates* Implementación de Kubernetes / Go Local*
   - *Mejoras AWS* -
      - Nico: ahora trabajando con autenticador de 2F con una app que
      trabaja dockerizada.

messages.subject: Luciano Interivew
messages.text:
I added note in lever too

https://hire.lever.co/candidates/858a6807-ff50-4e7d-90dd-57603c6659f8/notes￼

I spoke to him - he's definitely more data scientist and less programmer.  Not a fit for Celara - HOWEVER I wonder if he's a fit for what Chromatics wants too their Data Science type role - this guy teaches and works on that type of stuff.

Only issue is that his English is not amazing.

English is not amazing.

Good thing is a) he's free lancing right now at $20/hr b) long term he's looking for $3k.  So not as expensive and if he fits in with Franco perhaps could be useful.

Next steps
a) See if chromatics is interested in a less expensive more data scientist 
b) If so - firm up the JD and criteria and see if we can interview
c) see if he needs to work with Chromatics directly or can work under Franco

<@U049MGTGP6J>, <@UDHBPSC21> -I spoke with Amyn - there goal has always been to do this work in house.  My suggestion is in about 7-10 days time we reach out to Amyn and Alexa and ask the following:

1] Do they want to hire a more mid-level developer to work with Franco

2] Do they want support from the team for a lesser amount so 1.0 FTE for December

In general they are going to try to wrap up the project as planned - but we can see.

Also if we have many other places we need Emi and German and they dont have time - we can certainly push NOT to have any of their time with Chromatics.

messages.subject: Minuta Interna Mototech - 11/11/2025
messages.text:
PROYECTOS ON-GOING:

   - CARPEDM | In progress. UX design *retomado *(Emilia) -  Migración ioS
      (con equipo externo): *Comenzó *Lorenzo, debería llevar 1 mes. *Sprint
      de OCT entregado el jueves 6/11. Últimos ajustes para subir a prod. *
      - AFAB   *|* In progress  - Entregado Sprint 3, Sprint 4. *Pendiente
      de Marga armar requerimiento, y backlog a Dan para ver si
hacemos phase 2.*
         - Avisar cuándo se puede poner en pausa la instancia AWS (ambiente
         DEV) del cliente a Nico.
      - *Chromatics.ai* | In Progress. *Sprint 3 cerrado, hoy reunión con
      cliente. Queda último sprint - que se estima que se va a
extender 1 semana
      - mediado dic*.
      - *Staffing *| In progress. 15 búsquedas abiertas.* Foco en IA. Foco
      AI - QB. *
         - *AVM *(consultora) Kick off el viernes -* 4 o 5 perfiles de
         nicho*
         - *Collective *- se presentaron candidatos esta semana
         - Cliente nuevo: Podifyia - *está con Pablo/Z x comercial*.
         - *Chromatics *- Franco cerrada y la otra busqueda stand by*.*
         - *QU *1 postulante avanza, el otro no, y queda 1 de seguridad.
         - Exploración de mercado en oriente
         - *No se pierdan el programa* *Referrals !🤑🥇 *
      - *Tryni 2.0*  | In progress.Esperando aprobación de @Emiliano
      Gasparovic <egasparovic@celaralabs.com>  para hacer el deploy a prod. gpt
      v4 deprecado en Marzo 2925, se necesita migrar Team pediatrico.
      - *RCA  *| Proyecto Interno.Pruebas: @Carolina Tommasi @Melisa Behotas .
      Sin updates.
      - Altu*m **|* In progress Intención de sumar recursos (Seba) - Sin
      update.* Abrieron una búsqueda AI/QA manual. *
      - Portillos  *|* In progress sin respuesta, queda 1 mes de soporte
      nada más. German.


EN PROPUESTA

   - Go (Finanzas para México) - En propuesta. no va a avanzar .
      - *Bankar *- Paraguay.  Procesan pagos (similar a Prisma). Se
      propuso POC chica para info de errores con pagos. Está en manos de Seba
      cerrar.  @Emiliano Gasparovic <egasparovic@celaralabs.com>
      - *Nissei Retail Paraguay *- No avanzaron con la propuesta, Seba
      buscando una reunión para negociar. . @German Grin
      <ggrin@celaralabs.com>

   PROSPECTOS:
   - PKF Colombia (Finanzas Cripto) - Lo tiene Seba, sin updates.
      - *PKF Paraguay - cementera.*  Se pasó presupuesto, quedamos a espera
      de proyectos futuros.
      - *CEAMSE*. * On Hold lo de sistema de sensores. Y se activó una
      implementación SAP - se tercerizó. In progress. *
         - *Documentación y Monitoreo *están On Hold por el cliente.
      - *Aeropuertos argentinos 2000. *Sin Updates
      - *Lumina americas- *Sin Updates
      - *DAS (Congreso)* - Sin novedades. German contactar a Luciano.
      - *Puertos DockSud* - Se arranca 2026
      - *Trenes Argentinos -* reunión 19/08. Está firme, pero no hay fecha
      de comienzo. On hold hasta 2026.
      - *CATHAY SAE*. Camiones, remolques. Paraguay. El
      requerimiento/expectativa no es sencillo de armar, info no disponible


Otras Actividades Internas - todo con prioridad baja

   - *AWS *Alinear con la parte comercial (Sebas Gonza) Pendiente. Sin
   Updates* Implementación de Kubernetes / Go Local*
   - *Mejoras AWS* -
      - Nico: ahora trabajando con autenticador de 2F con una app que
      trabaja dockerizada. Sin muchos updates.

      phase 2. *

         DEV) del cliente a Nico.

      dailys para ver como cerrar.  - se extiende sprint 4 a 1 semana mas
      (28/11).
      - *Staffing *| In progress. 15 búsquedas abiertas.* Foco en IA. Foco

         da de baja

EN PROPUESTA

      - *Nissei Retail Paraguay *- Se reenvio propuesta. Seba buscando una
      reunión para negociar. . @German Grin <ggrin@celaralabs.com>

   PROSPECTOS:

      - *Lumina americas- *Sin Updates

Otras Actividades Internas - todo con prioridad baja

   - *AWS *Alinear con la parte comercial (Sebas Gonza) Pendiente. Sin

<@UDJ7CJXU7> and team FYI we will be moving forward with Chromatics for December.

This is fro Alexa - I'll work with Pablo on SOW.
> Ok spoke to him already. Lets keep the team for Dec as you proposed as I want good continuity for the project and I want a solid demo-able product for Dec. If you send me the SOW extension i can have it signed and approved.
> I will also bring in another FE from Chromatics and see how he can work w Franco, expecting some delays on his ramp up and productivity, but hopefully over time they can figure out a good working system.

This is fro Alexa - I'll work with Pablo on SOW.
> Ok spoke to him already. Lets keep the team for Dec as you proposed as I want good continuity for the project and I want a solid demo-able product for Dec. If you send me the SOW extension i can have it signed and approved.

elements.text:
and team FYI we will be moving forward with Chromatics for December.

This is fro Alexa - I'll work with Pablo on SOW.

Ok spoke to him already. Lets keep the team for Dec as you proposed as I want good continuity for the project and I want a solid demo-able product for Dec. If you send me the SOW extension i can have it signed and approved.
I will also bring in another FE from Chromatics and see how he can work w Franco, expecting some delays on his ramp up and productivity, but hopefully over time they can figure out a good working system.

I'm doing a round of touching base with everyone important in our funnel, from here to mid-December. I think it's a good time since many are planning 2026, but <@U05C6H7G8JH> pls confirm. Idea is to reach out with something like "we want to share what we've been doing this last semester". I know we can use Altum's name but IDK for the other three.
I can slightly modify them when a couterpart is not technical, something plainer.
Every suggestion is welcome.
*note that in Altum's case it's not "we created", because it's not our project - slightly ambiguous on purpose

*1) Altum Case Study*
A fast-cycle AI program delivered four working prototypes that automated eligibility checks, ranked opportunities, surfaced best-fit matches, and assisted users multimodally with platform navigation. The project replaced slow manual review with intelligent document ingestion, criteria extraction, semantic matching, and conversational interaction, reducing decision time and improving accuracy. The solution included functional UIs, integrated Python backends, modular LLM agents, and a feedback-driven development loop, enabling the client to validate ROI, uncover real adoption pathways, and define a scalable roadmap for future production integration.

*2) Public Relay Case Study* 
We built and validated two AI systems that transformed article processing reliability and throughput: a URL completion engine that reconstructed missing source links using search + LLM validation, and a metadata extraction pipeline that accurately retrieved authorship and publication dates at scale. Both components shipped as containerized micro-services, tested on multiple models for price-performance fit, and integrated directly into existing data infrastructure. The outcome unlocked >90 percent accuracy, reduced manual intervention dramatically, and prepared the client for rapid production rollout with reusable, expandable AI blocks.

*3) Portillo's Case Study* 
We delivered an AI-powered contract processing platform that automated document review, identified key clauses, tracked renewal dates and legal obligations, and highlighted differences across versions for fast comparison. Manual bottlenecks were replaced by NLP extraction, OCR-enhanced document understanding, and a secure cloud architecture with collaborative access. This reduced contract cycle effort by roughly seventy-five percent, increased accuracy, enabled auditable visibility, and allowed the legal team to shift focus to strategic work rather than repetitive review.

*4) Chromatics Case Study*
We built an AI Visibility Audit Platform that evaluates how a set of ten brands appear across major AI engines such as ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity, Copilot, and Google AI Overviews. The platform runs structured prompt suites, collects and standardizes responses, and extracts brand mentions, competitive references, citations, and regional differences. We delivered an end-to-end system—query executor, analytics engine, scoring models, and an executive dashboard—producing clear visibility metrics, competitive benchmarks, underlying evidence captures, and actionable insights for improving how brands show up inside AI-generated answers.

messages.text:
Team, regarding marketing our cases
we've spoken with Public Relay who says "use it but anonymous"
Chromatics, we can use the Brand Name!
Altum too
Portillo's we decided not to bug them, so we'll do it Anonmously
here's what I'll be sending and anyone can use:

*1) Altum Case Study*
A fast-cycle AI program delivered four working prototypes that automated eligibility checks, ranked opportunities, surfaced best-fit matches, and assisted users multimodally with platform navigation. The project replaced slow manual review with intelligent document ingestion, criteria extraction, semantic matching, and conversational interaction, reducing decision time and improving accuracy. The solution included functional UIs, integrated Python backends, modular LLM agents, and a feedback-driven development loop, enabling the client to validate ROI, uncover real adoption pathways, and define a scalable roadmap for future production integration.

*2) Media Analytics Case Study*
We developed and validated two AI systems that transform article processing reliability and throughput. The first is a URL completion engine that reconstructs missing source links using a hybrid approach of search APIs, web scraping, and LLM-based validation. The second is a metadata extraction pipeline that retrieves publication dates and cross-references extracted authors to match specific entries within the client's existing knowledge base. Both components ship as containerized micro-services designed for seamless deployment. The outcome significantly improves accuracy over legacy workflows, reduces manual intervention, and establishes a scalable foundation for future feature expansion.

*3) Document Intelligence Case Study*
We delivered an AI-powered contract processing platform that automated document review, identified key clauses, tracked renewal dates and legal obligations, and highlighted differences across versions for fast comparison. Manual bottlenecks were replaced by NLP extraction, OCR-enhanced document understanding, and a secure cloud architecture with collaborative access. This reduced contract cycle effort by roughly seventy-five percent, increased accuracy, enabled auditable visibility, and allowed the legal team to shift focus to strategic work rather than repetitive review.

*4) Chromatics Case Study*
We're building a custom AI Visibility Audit Platform from scratch that evaluates how an undefined number of brands appear across major AI engines like ChatGPT, Gemini, and Perplexity. The platform runs structured prompt suites, collects and standardizes responses, and performs deep analysis including brand mentions, competitive references, citations, and sentiment analysis. We deliver an end-to-end system (comprising a query executor, analytics engine, and executive dashboard) that features a specialized agent to generate personalized recommendations for improving visibility and positioning within generative AI search results.

EN PROPUESTA

      - *Nissei Retail Paraguay *- Se reenvio propuesta. Seba buscando una

      de comienzo. On hold hasta 2026.
      - *CATHAY SAE*. Camiones, remolques. Paraguay. El
      requerimiento/expectativa no es sencillo de armar, info no
disponible. Del
      lado de Sebas.  Emi habló con Sebas pero están con idas y vueltas
      acerca de la info que necesitan.
      - *Marriott -* puede salir proyecto. Predecir demanda y rango de
      precios. Sin novedades. Del lado de Pablo / Sebas(Comercial de USA)
      - *Intermediano:* Emi hizo estimación de tiempo. POC de 4 semanas
      (CVS) y 5 semanas (AI) Seba debería mandar la propuesta.


Otras Actividades Internas - todo con prioridad baja

   - *Mejoras AWS* -
      - Nico: ahora trabajando con autenticador de 2F con una app que
      trabaja dockerizada. Sin muchos updates, están trabados. Sin novedades.
   - *Portillos*

messages.text:
<@U076Q8F00M6> drafted this for Chromatics looks good to me.  <@UDHBPSC21>, <@UDJ7CJXU7> any suggestions?  Otherwise <@U076Q8F00M6> will send this out soon.  Send just to Alexa and cc Amyn.

> Hi Alexa,
> 
> I hope you’re both doing well. I wanted to share a brief update as we approach the final phase of our engagement.
> 
> Emiliano is on track to complete his allocated 80 hours for this month. He will be taking time off during the last week of December (December 24–31), so his final day on the project will be December 23. In the meantime, Franco has fully taken the lead on the backend codebase, ensuring a smooth and well-documented transition.
> 
> On the frontend side, Jon will continue supporting the project through the end of the month, as he is not taking time off during that period.
> 
> With this in mind, we will be wrapping up our involvement in the project by the end of the month, after which your internal team will continue development. It has been a pleasure working with you, and we truly appreciate the collaboration.
> 
> Please don’t hesitate to reach out if there is anything we can do to support the transition or assist your team during the ramp-up.
> 
> Best regards,
> 
> German.-

elements.text: drafted this for Chromatics looks good to me.
will send this out soon.  Send just to Alexa and cc Amyn.

Hi Alexa,

I hope you’re both doing well. I wanted to share a brief update as we approach the final phase of our engagement.

Emiliano is on track to complete his allocated 80 hours for this month. He will be taking time off during the last week of December (December 24–31), so his final day on the project will be December 23. In the meantime, Franco has fully taken the lead on the backend codebase, ensuring a smooth and well-documented transition.

On the frontend side, Jon will continue supporting the project through the end of the month, as he is not taking time off during that period.

With this in mind, we will be wrapping up our involvement in the project by the end of the month, after which your internal team will continue development. It has been a pleasure working with you, and we truly appreciate the collaboration.

Please don’t hesitate to reach out if there is anything we can do to support the transition or assist your team during the ramp-up.

Best regards,

German.-

messages.subject: Re: Intro to Celara talent team and first candidate for the role
messages.text:
Oh good that you used GPT to calibrate.  

I agree there can be some concerns - but I think the role is actually reasonable now that I understand it better - its not very different conceptually from what Chromatics was looking for (seniority wise).

Not easy, but do-able.

And I will say
a) Walt is a good guy to work with
b) there is GREAT opportunity to learn about Top Tier Finance - Tech - at Wall Street from John and Walt.

Its a nice opportunity for the right person.

messages.text:
Here sharing current status and tasks for today and early tomorrow:
• Andres working on the data extracted for chromatics (available in the drive) and in the proposal to use embeddings to determine relevance score. Results are <https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/13N0bJ9ODIcNQV5HC-tgzonwhwHcNE6hr|here>
• I'm working on the instance matching. When moving forward I noticed some missing information for this step. I already added it, so it's almost done to match actions and instances. I'll probably have to use an LLM call, but will try to avoid doing it.
• By tomorrow these all should be finished, so we can start testing with the Chromatics information

messages.text:
Hi Zubair, Vicky. Just got the daily scrum with Andres.

1. Got to run the full pipeline with the synth data. I still need to review the results, but in the end around 20 update actions emerge.
2. Currently trying to run with Chromatics
    a. Andres will work on getting the embeddings based score, and after that, to improve segmentation
    b. After that we will work on segmentation to determine better segments before processing to avoid generating too many action hypotheses
3. In parallel, I'll continue with the following milestones definition
